Name: Automating GUI-based Software Testing with GPT-3
Highlight: Applies GPT-3’s language understanding capabilities to GUI-based software testing, enabling natural interaction through text-based test case descriptions.

Name: GUI-based Software Testing: An Automated Approach Using GPT-4 and Selenium WebDriver
Highlight: Performs end-to-end GUI testing using GPT-4's natural language understanding and reasoning capabilities.

Name: Make LLM a Testing Expert: Bringing Human-like Interaction to Mobile GUI Testing via Functionality-aware Decisions
Highlight: Formulates GUI testing as a Q&A task, utilizing LLM capabilities to provide human-like interaction.

Name: Intent-driven mobile gui testing with autonomoufs large language model agentsT
Highlight: Autonomously generates and executes high-level, realistic tasks for Android GUI testing based on app-specific functionalities.

Name: AUITestAgent: Automatic Requirements Oriented GUI Function Testing
Highlight: Features dynamic agent organization for step-oriented testing and a multi-source data extraction strategy for precise function verification.

Name: Vision-driven Automated Mobile GUI Testing via Multimodal Large Language Model
Highlight: Integrates vision-driven prompts and GUI text alignment with vision-language models to enhance understanding of GUI contexts and app logic.

Name: AXNav: Replaying Accessibility Tests from Natural Language
Highlight: Adapts to natural language test instructions and generates annotated videos to visually and interactively review accessibility test results.

Name: Large Language Models for Mobile GUI Text Input Generation: An Empirical Study
Highlight: Demonstrates the effectiveness of various LLMs in generating context-aware text inputs, improving UI test coverage, and identifying previously unreported bugs.

Name: Fill in the Blank: Context-aware Automated Text Input Generation for Mobile GUI Testing
Highlight: Formulates text input generation as a cloze-style fill-in-the-blank language task.

Name: CrashTranslator: Automatically Reproducing Mobile Application Crashes Directly from Stack Trace
Highlight: Leverages LLMs for iterative GUI navigation and crash reproduction from stack traces, integrating a reinforcement learning-based scoring system to optimize exploration steps.

Name: Prompting Is All You Need: Automated Android Bug Replay with Large Language Models
Highlight: Combines prompt engineering with few-shot learning and chain-of-thought reasoning to leverage LLMs for GUI-based tasks.

Name: Improving Technical "How-to" Query Accuracy with Automated Search Results Verification and Reranking
Highlight: Features a three-stage process: extracting instructions, executing them in a simulated environment, and reranking search results based on execution outcomes.

Name: Automated Test Transfer Across Android Apps Using Large Language Models
Highlight: Leverages multimodal LLMs to perform UI test transfers without requiring source code access

Name: UXAgent: An LLM Agent-Based Usability Testing Framework for Web Design
Highlight: Enables LLM-powered automated usability testing by simulating thousands of user interactions, collecting both qualitative and quantitative data, and providing researchers with early feedback before real-user studies.

Name: Guardian: A Runtime Framework for LLM-Based UI Exploration
Highlight: Autonomously explores mobile applications, interacting with the UI to validate core functionalities.

Name: Test-Agent: A Multimodal App Automation Testing Framework Based on the Large Language Model
Highlight: Eliminates the need for pre-written test scripts by leveraging LLMs and multimodal perception to generate and execute test cases automatically.
